ula_ula added to the channel by martinh.

hi all - this is the channel for the cashflow app we spoke about on Friday.

here is a description document made by the customer

in essence , we need to create an app with the fields in step 1 that will keep data about transactions , fetch currency conversion rate at the time of adding the transaction and calculate the conversion sum at the transaction day (when funds are sent to client).

so to be more precise:
1. user adds a transaction , for example, customer A wants to send 1000 Euro to customer B but Customer A pays in Rubles.
2. the conversion rate from RUB to EUR is calculated at the day of adding the transaction.
3. the money in Euro is sent to customer B 3 days later (for example)
4. the conversion rate to send 1000 EUR in RUB at the day of sending the funds in Euro to customer B is calculated again and the difference is shown (and saved.

This is the initial step.

## Guidelines:
- Data will be kept in rqlite
- backend should be written in golang (@sergeyl @martinh please cooperate on this - @sergeyl is in lead).
- Frontend should be written in ReactJS (please also allow PWA functionality) by @fenrir - @sergeyl is in lead.
- GIT repos will be created for both FE and BE
- Authentication should be a minimal mechanism as this is going to be protected by VPN and for internal use (not exposed to the internet)
- Backend should check if DB schema exists and if not - create it (we might reuse this app for other organizations).

@sergeyl as the lead on this project please provide estimates and communicate with @fenrir and @martinh to provide ETA for first working version. Anything you need from me I am available.
@admin got you. For go we need first good libraries picks.
@martinh For example, lets try goose for db migrations. Projects should have root folder `migtate` for sql files. Format for filename should include date-description.sql
As BE dev, do you yave any wishes/ready ideas regarding schema for our task?
@admin regarding ETA could you give me abit of time to get into and evaluate developement speed?

@fenrir regarding to FE lets start with auth, typical thing - establish reactjs env which will be guarded with a component that is rendering children in case if you have access token in local storage, if not - render auth page. Lets stick to jwt standard and opendid connect in future with sso, if its needed, but lets plan it from the start cuz they are worldwide standarts today. I think working with money we should think security-first way
I'm reading task, I'll write back
@admin Today, I've created task decomposition (with rough time estimates):

@sergeyl @martinh the above ( what @vic  sent) is a sample csv (excel) file to import into the application
Good. Reading csv isn't a big deal actually, whenever its correctly formed
But its not a csv, its excel file, actually I was working with excelize library for go

1. we can ask them to convert 
2. we can perform the file ingestion using excelize
for now convert to csv when we get to it - we can implement the excelize pkg later on after we have a working version
Yep.  Now im working ok transaction stage pages. At the moment every thing else is done
can you guys setup a session between yourself to attach FE to BE? or you need me in the session?
Regarding endpoints, for exchange-rates , @igorsmi have just pushed the repo, i havent seen it yet. But I am thinking to separate exchange rates endpoint to separate microservice

np - but I would not use redis for it - I dont see a lot (not more than 100 an hour and even that is too large) so I propose to use an rqlite table for it - we can improve in the future but for now deploying redis and working with it seems a bit redundant for our stage

I've implemented endpoints: 
1) authorization: login, get user info
2) add one client, get all clients
3) add one foreign legal entity, get all foreign legal entities
4) add report( client request+ client transaction models), after calculations it will create data and there will be 3 inserts.
Get report by request number
The only endpoint to tweak is add one report ( no calculations yet, but it can be called from fe)
I'm always in touch with @fenrir and @ula_ula
Kk will ask to remake to rqlike, but codewise its harder - need migrations, create schemes, etc. okay will think how to getout of situation if you dont like redis

I think Redis is good for handling such queries, because speed is important. queries for constantly needed data + it reduces the load on the DB. But if it is necessary to remake it to rqlite, then I will do it
@martinh btw have you managed migration microservice with goose working, in the end? ü¶Ü

evgeniisokolov added to the channel by sergeyl.

@admin 

1. XLS import for both step1 and step2
2. Add a reference(foreign key) between step1 and step2 - to link step2 transaction to step1
3. Step3 - Per-order profit/loss in USD, and RUB, and gain %
4. TX Table - Add order status (new, processing, done)
5. Add per-day aggregation of orders in done status
6. Auth microservice integration
7. Couple of bugfixes (3-rd screen breaks sometimes, auth issue)
8. Small ui improvements - add UI transitions for button/input/table row hovers (easy to do, makes good inpression on customer)

1. please create gitlab tasks :pray: 
2. what is the timeline to finish and release to them?

Hi, all!)
The customer is satisfied.
The presentation was about 3 hours.
We discussed many details, in order to develop the system further.
So tomorrow we are going to create HLD. Then we are going to create EPICs with features next week, using HLD, and coordinate the one with you and the customer.
On monday the customer will send us examples of Excel files.
Also we created the chat in the MM with the customer, in order to resolve operational issues faster.
Well-done...any ETA when they will go production?
We have agreed with the customer, that we will announce the deadline after the EPICs estimate on the next week.
Let's try to do this fast this is an important win for us
